sub_rules.content: For the remaining non-ASCII characters, either the actual Unicode character (e.g. ∞) or the equivalent Unicode escape (e.g. \u221e) is used.
sub_rules.formalization: non_ASCII_character must be constrained to be (Unicode_character ∨ Unicode_escape_character)

sub_rules.content: The choice depends only on which makes the code easier to read and understand
sub_rules.formalization:
Unicode_character.readability > Unicode_escape_character.readability => non_ASCII_character must be constrained to be Unicode_character ≻ non_ASCII_character must be constrained to be Unicode_escape_character;
Unicode_escape_character.readability > Unicode_character.readability => non_ASCII_character must be constrained to be Unicode_escape_character≻ non_ASCII_character must be constrained to be Unicode_character;

sub_rules.content: Unicode escapes outside string literals and comments are strongly discouraged.
sub_rules.formalization: (source code \ (string literals ∨ comments) ) may not contain Unicode escapes
